title: 1. Introduction
text: Google Earth Engine cloud-based platform helps access high-performance computing resources processing analyzing large geospatial datasets (Noel Golerick et al.,2017).

title: 1. Introduction
text: accessible various professionals without experts handling supercomputers. Reduce pre-post processing time satellite images local, regional global scale. Implement application development without backend/frontend expert. Boost development big data remote sensing.

title: 1. Introduction
text: Data catalog: Curated collection several petabytes geospatial datasets widely used remote sensing available general public. High performance computing service: Google’s computational infrastructure optimize parallel processing distribution geospatial data. API client libraries: Application programming interface making requests Earth Engine servers. Client libraries Code Editor REST API JavaScript Python R (official)

title: 1. Introduction
text: access benefits offered Earth Engine platform, must active Google (Gmail) account. register, go 👉 https://code.earthengine.google.com/register. Earth Engine offers two registration options: Commercial user: commercial product development, service monetization, related purposes. Non-commercial user: research, education, academic activities. purposes, proceed selecting non-commercial user option.  can install development version land4health GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("harmonize-tools/land4health") library(land4health) ── Welcome to land4health ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── A tool of Harmonize Project to calculate and extract Remote Sensing Metrics for Spatial Health Analysis. Currently,`land4health` supports metrics in the following categories: • Accesibility • Climate • Enviroment • and more! For a complete list of available metrics, use the `l4h_list_metrics()` function.  ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Attaching core land4health packages: → rgee v1.1.7 → sf v1.0.21 l4h_install() ── Installing land4health Python dependencies ─────────────── ℹ Step 1/3: Checking Python environment ℹ Step 2/3: Installing Python packages ✔ Python packages installed successfully ℹ Step 3/3: Finalizing setup ✔ land4health setup completed. ee_Initialize() #> ── rgee 1.1.7 ─────────────────────────────────────── earthengine-api 0.1.370 ──  #>  ✔ user: not_defined  #>  ✔ Initializing Google Earth Engine: ✔ Initializing Google Earth Engine:  DONE! #>  ✔ Earth Engine account: users/geografo2023  #>  ✔ Python Path: C:/Users/mvcs_dgppvu_ambi/AppData/Local/R/cache/R/reticulate/uv/cache/archive-v0/At8gJm7EZeLgoj4R1d2hk/Scripts/python.exe  #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── land4health::l4h_packages() #> [1] "rgee"        "sf"          "land4health"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Antony Barja. Author, maintainer. Yomali Ferreyra. Author. Diego Villa. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Barja , Ferreyra Y (2025). land4health: Remote Sensing Metrics Spatial Health Analysis. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/harmonize-tools/land4health/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {land4health: Remote Sensing Metrics for Spatial Health Analysis},   author = {Antony Barja and Yomali Ferreyra},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/harmonize-tools/land4health/}, }

title: Harmonize
text: Calculate extract remote sensing metrics spatial health analysis 🛰️. package offers R users quick easy way obtain areal zonal statistics key indicators covariates, ideal modeling infectious diseases 🦠 within framework spatial epidemiology 🏥.

title: Harmonize
text: can install CRAN version land4health : can install development version :
code: install.packages("land4health") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("harmonize-tools/land4health") library(land4health) ee_Initialize(quiet = TRUE) ── Welcome to land4health ──────────────────────────────────────────────────── A tool of Harmonize Project to calculate and extract Remote Sensing Metrics for Spatial Health Analysis. Currently,`land4health` supports metrics in the following categories: • Accesibility • Climate • Enviroment • and more! For a complete list of available metrics, use the `l4h_list_metrics()` function.  ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Attaching core land4health packages: → rgee v1.1.7 → sf v1.0.21

title: Harmonize
code: l4h_list_metrics() #> # A tibble: 10 × 11 #>    category           metric  pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>    <chr>              <chr>   <chr>                  <chr>        <int>    <int> #>  1 Human intervention Defore… 30                     Hansen…       2000     2023 #>  2 Human intervention Human … 300                    Global…       1990     2017 #>  3 Human intervention Popula… 100                    WorldP…       2000     2021 #>  4 Human intervention Urban … 500                    MODIS …       2001     2022 #>  5 Human intervention Night … 500                    VIIRS …       1992     2023 #>  6 Human intervention Human … 30                     Global…       1975     2030 #>  7 Enviroment         Water … 30                     MapBio…       1985     2022 #>  8 Enviroment         Urban … 1000                   Urban …       2003     2020 #>  9 Accesibility       Travel… 927.67                 Malari…       2019     2020 #> 10 Accesibility       Rural … 100                    Rural …       2024     2024 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr> #> ... (1 more)

what: 3. Example: Calculate Forest Loss in a Custom Region
title: Harmonize
text: example demonstrates calculate forest loss 2005 2020 using custom polygon Earth Engine.
code: library(geoidep)  # Downloading the adminstration limits of Loreto provinces provinces_loreto <- get_provinces(show_progress = FALSE) |>   subset(nombdep == "LORETO")  # Run forest loss calculation result <- provinces_loreto |>   l4h_forest_loss(from = '2005-01-01', to = '2020-01-01', sf = TRUE) head(result) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 11 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -76.89454 ymin: -6.14773 xmax: -75.38564 ymax: -3.681529 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 6 × 12 #>      id objectid ccdd  ccpp  nombdep nombprov shape_length shape_area date       #>   <int>    <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr>           <dbl>      <dbl> <date>     #> 1   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2005-01-01 #> 2   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2006-01-01 #> 3   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2007-01-01 #> 4   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2008-01-01 #> 5   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2009-01-01 #> 6   136      136 16    02    LORETO  ALTO AM…         9.96       1.57 2010-01-01 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: variable <chr>, value <dbl>, geometry <MULTIPOLYGON [°]> # Visualization with ggplot2 library(ggplot2) ggplot(data = st_drop_geometry(result), aes(x = date, y = value)) +   geom_area(fill = "#FDE725FF", alpha = 0.8) +   facet_wrap(~nombprov) +   theme_minimal() # Spatial visualization ggplot(data = result) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = value), color = NA) +   scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Forest loss mean \n(km²)") +   theme_minimal(base_size = 15) +   facet_wrap(date ~ .)

what: 4. Example: Extract time series of climate variables
title: Harmonize
code: etp_ts <- provinces_loreto |>   l4h_sebal_modis(     from = "2005-01-01",     to = "2022-12-31",     by = "month"   ) etp_ts |>   st_drop_geometry() |>   ggplot(aes(x = date, y = value, col = value)) +   geom_line() +   scale_color_viridis_c("ETP (mm)",option = "viridis") +   theme_minimal() +   facet_wrap(~nombprov, ncol = 4)

what: Extracts carbon monoxide (CO) concentration from Sentinel-5P TROPOMI — l4h_co_column

text: Retrieves CO column number density (mol/m2) user-defined region date range Sentinel‑5P TROPOMI OFFLINE L3 CO dataset.

title: Extracts carbon monoxide (CO) concentration from Sentinel-5P TROPOMI — l4h_co_column
code: l4h_co_column(   from,   to,   region,   stat = "mean",   scale = 1113,   sf = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Extracts carbon monoxide (CO) concentration from Sentinel-5P TROPOMI — l4h_co_column
text: Character. Start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format (e.g., "2020-01-01"). Character. End date "YYYY-MM-DD" format (e.g., "2020-12-31"). region spatial object (sf, sfc, SpatVector) defining region interest. stat Character. Summary statistic apply ("mean", "median", "max", etc.). scale Numeric. Nominal scale meters. Default 1113. sf Logical. Return result sf? Default: TRUE. quiet Logical. Suppress progress messages? Default: FALSE. force Logical. Force extract without spatial check? Default: FALSE. ... Arguments passed rgee::ee_extract.

title: Extracts carbon monoxide (CO) concentration from Sentinel-5P TROPOMI — l4h_co_column
text: sf tibble containing CO column density (mol/m2) date geometry.

title: Extracts carbon monoxide (CO) concentration from Sentinel-5P TROPOMI — l4h_co_column
text: function uses Earth Engine dataset COPERNICUS/S5P/OFFL/L3_CO selects "CO_column_number_density" band. supports summarization using reducer statistic per image.

title: Extracts carbon monoxide (CO) concentration from Sentinel-5P TROPOMI — l4h_co_column
text: COPERNICUS/S5P/OFFL/L3_CO. Sentinel‑5P Offline L3 Carbon Monoxide. European Union / ESA / Copernicus. https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/catalog/COPERNICUS_S5P_OFFL_L3_CO

what: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
title: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
text: global database publicly available dengue case data. OpenDengue Project provides harmonized, open-access repository dengue surveillance data national ministries health across Latin America regions. function enables programmatic access weekly case counts downloading, caching, unzipping, reading, filtering national, spatial, temporal extracts region country specified date range, returning ready--use tibble.

title: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
code: l4h_dengue_cases(   from,   to,   data_type = c("temporal", "spatial", "national"),   region = NULL,   country = "Peru",   cache = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
text: Data OpenDengue Project.

title: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
text: Start date (YYYY-MM-DD). End date (YYYY-MM-DD). data_type One "national", "spatial", "temporal". region Region code full name (case-insensitive). Codes: "paho", "searo", "wpro", "afro", "emro", "euro". Full names: "Pan-American Region", "South-East Asia Region", "Western Pacific Region", "African Region", "Eastern Mediterranean Region", "European Region". country Country name (case-insensitive, e.g., "peru"), matched adm_0_name. cache Logical. TRUE, caches downloaded ZIP locally. quiet Logical. TRUE, prints progress status via cli.

title: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
text: tibble columns: date_start, date_end, cases, state, area, plus fields.

title: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
text: Developed Innovalab Team info@innovalab.com Innovalab: Pioneering geospatial health analytics open‐science tools. Stay connected: follow us Twitter @InnovalabGeo

title: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
text: Morales, . et al. (2024). OpenDengue: Harmonized dengue surveillance data Latin America.

title: Extract dengue case data from OpenDengue — l4h_dengue_cases
code: # \donttest{ # National extract for Peru in 2019 df_nat <- l4h_dengue_cases(   from = "2019-01-01",   to = "2019-12-31",   data_type = "national",   region = "paho",   country = "peru",   cache = TRUE,   quiet = TRUE) #> Preparing national extract for Pan-American Region and PERU #> Downloading National_extract_PAHO_V1_3.zip... #> Preparing national extract for Pan-American Region and PERU  head(df_nat) #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>   adm_0_name state area  full_name ISO_A0 FAO_GAUL_code RNE_iso_code IBGE_code #>   <chr>      <lgl> <lgl> <chr>     <chr>          <int> <chr>        <lgl>     #> 1 PERU       NA    NA    PERU      PER          1011442 PER          NA        #> 2 PERU       NA    NA    PERU      PER          1011442 PER          NA        #> 3 PERU       NA    NA    PERU      PER          1011442 PER          NA        #> 4 PERU       NA    NA    PERU      PER          1011442 PER          NA        #> 5 PERU       NA    NA    PERU      PER          1011442 PER          NA        #> 6 PERU       NA    NA    PERU      PER          1011442 PER          NA        #> # ℹ 9 more variables: date_start <chr>, date_end <chr>, Year <int>, #> #   cases <dbl>, case_definition_standardised <chr>, S_res <chr>, T_res <chr>, #> #   UUID <chr>, region <chr>  # Spatial extract for Brazil first half 2021 df_spat <- l4h_dengue_cases(   from = "2021-01-01",   to = "2021-12-31",   data_type = "spatial",   region = "Pan-American Region",   country = "brazil",  cache = TRUE,  quiet = TRUE) #> Preparing spatial extract for Pan-American Region and BRAZIL #> Downloading Spatial_extract_PAHO_V1_3.zip... #> Preparing spatial extract for Pan-American Region and BRAZIL  head(df_spat) #> # A tibble: 1 × 17 #>   adm_0_name state area  full_name ISO_A0 FAO_GAUL_code RNE_iso_code IBGE_code #>   <chr>      <chr> <chr> <chr>     <chr>          <int> <chr>        <lgl>     #> 1 BRAZIL     NA    NA    BRAZIL    BRA               37 BRA          NA        #> # ℹ 9 more variables: date_start <chr>, date_end <chr>, Year <int>, #> #   cases <dbl>, case_definition_standardised <chr>, S_res <chr>, T_res <chr>, #> #   UUID <chr>, region <chr>  # Temporal extract for Argentina in 2020 df_temp <- l4h_dengue_cases(   from = "2020-01-01",   to = "2020-12-31",   data_type = "temporal",   region = "PAHO",   country = "Argentina",   cache = TRUE,   quiet = TRUE) #> Preparing temporal extract for Pan-American Region and ARGENTINA #> Downloading Temporal_extract_PAHO_V1_3.zip... #> Preparing temporal extract for Pan-American Region and ARGENTINA  head(df_temp) #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>   adm_0_name state   area  full_name ISO_A0 FAO_GAUL_code RNE_iso_code IBGE_code #>   <chr>      <chr>   <chr> <chr>     <chr>          <int> <chr>        <lgl>     #> 1 ARGENTINA  NA      NA    ARGENTINA ARG               12 ARG          NA        #> 2 ARGENTINA  SALTA   ANTA  ARGENTIN… ARG             4765 AR-A         NA        #> 3 ARGENTINA  MISION… CAND… ARGENTIN… ARG             4722 AR-N         NA        #> 4 ARGENTINA  MISION… CAPI… ARGENTIN… ARG             4723 AR-N         NA        #> 5 ARGENTINA  ENTRE … DIAM… ARGENTIN… ARG             4621 AR-E         NA        #> 6 ARGENTINA  MISION… ELDO… ARGENTIN… ARG             4725 AR-N         NA        #> # ℹ 9 more variables: date_start <chr>, date_end <chr>, Year <int>, #> #   cases <dbl>, case_definition_standardised <chr>, S_res <chr>, T_res <chr>, #> #   UUID <chr>, region <chr> # }

what: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: Calculates forest loss within user-defined region specified year range. Forest loss defined stand-replacement disturbance, change forest non-forest state.

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
code: l4h_forest_loss(from, to, region, sf = TRUE, quiet = FALSE, force = FALSE, ...)

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: Character. Start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format (year used). Character. End date "YYYY-MM-DD" format (year used). region spatial object defining region interest. Accepts sf, sfc, SpatVector object (terra package). sf Logical. Return result sf object? Default TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). force Logical. Force request extract. ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: sf tibble object forest loss per year square kilometers.

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: Forest loss derived Hansen Global Forest Change dataset. lossyear band encodes year forest cover loss follows: Values range 1 n, 1 corresponds year 2001 n year 2000 + n. value 0 indicates forest loss detected.

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
text: Hansen, M. C., Potapov, P. V., Moore, R., Hancher, M., Turubanova, S. ., Tyukavina, ., ... & Townshend, J. R. G. (2013). High-Resolution Global Maps 21st-Century Forest Cover Change. Science, 342(6160), 850–853. DOI: doi:10.1126/science.1244693

title: Extracts forest cover loss within a defined polygon — l4h_forest_loss
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) ee_Initialize()  # Define region as a bounding box polygon region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # Run forest loss calculation result <- l4h_forest_loss(   from = '2005-01-01',   to = '2007-01-01',   region = region)  head(result) } # }

what: Extracts built‑up surface area from GHSL Built‑Up Surface dataset — l4h_human_built
title: Extracts built‑up surface area from GHSL Built‑Up Surface dataset — l4h_human_built
text: Retrieves total built‑surface area (m2 per 100m grid cell) GHSL Built-Surface dataset (GHS‑BUILT‑S R2023A), user-defined region date range. dataset provided 5‑year epochs (1975–2030) ~100m resolution.

title: Extracts built‑up surface area from GHSL Built‑Up Surface dataset — l4h_human_built
code: l4h_human_built(   from,   to,   region,   scale = 100,   sf = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Extracts built‑up surface area from GHSL Built‑Up Surface dataset — l4h_human_built
text: Character. Start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format (year used). Character. End date "YYYY-MM-DD" format (year used). region Spatial object (sf, sfc, SpatVector) defining region. scale Numeric. Resolution meters (default = 100). sf Logical. TRUE, returns sf; FALSE, returns tibble. Default = TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses progress output. Default = FALSE. force Logical. TRUE, bypass representativity checks. Default = FALSE. ... Arguments passed rgee::ee_extract().

title: Extracts built‑up surface area from GHSL Built‑Up Surface dataset — l4h_human_built
text: sf tibble columns date, variable, built_surface_m2.

title: Extracts built‑up surface area from GHSL Built‑Up Surface dataset — l4h_human_built
text: Pesaresi, M. & Politis, P. (2023). GHS‑BUILT‑S R2023A: Red de superficie construida de GHS, derivada de la composición de Sentinel-2 y Landsat, multitemporal (1975–2030). European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC). doi:10.2905/9F06F36F-4B11-47EC-ABB0-4F8B7B1D72EA . PID: http://data.europa.eu/89h/9f06f36f-4b11-47ec-abb0-4f8b7b1d72ea Pesaresi, M., Schiavina, M., Politis, P., Freire, S., Krasnodebska, K., Uhl, J.H., Carioli, ., et al. (2024). Avances en la capa de asentamientos humanos globales través de la evaluación conjunta de datos de observación de la Tierra y encuestas demográficas. International Journal Digital Earth, 17(1). doi:10.1080/17538947.2024.2390454 Dataset Google Earth Engine: https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/catalog/JRC_GHSL_P2023A_GHS_BUILT_S

title: Extracts built‑up surface area from GHSL Built‑Up Surface dataset — l4h_human_built
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) library(sf) ee_Initialize()  # Define a bounding box region in Ucayali, Peru region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # Extract built-up surface area from 2000 to 2020 built_area <- l4h_human_built(   from = "2000-01-01",   to = "2020-12-31",   region = region,   scale = 100,   stat = "sum" ) head(built_area)  # Example using as tibble built_tbl <- l4h_human_built(   from = "1990-01-01",   to = "2015-12-31",   region = region,   sf = FALSE,   stat = "mean" ) dplyr::glimpse(built_tbl) } # }

what: Install Python dependencies for land4health package — l4h_install
title: Install Python dependencies for land4health package — l4h_install
text: Installs required Python packages (earthengine-api numpy) using virtualenv, conda, system pip via reticulate package.

title: Install Python dependencies for land4health package — l4h_install
code: l4h_install(pip = TRUE, system = FALSE, force = FALSE, ...)

title: Install Python dependencies for land4health package — l4h_install
text: pip Logical. TRUE (default), uses pip installation. Automatically set FALSE method specified via .... system Logical. TRUE, uses system Python pip via system call. Defaults FALSE. force Logical. TRUE, forces reinstallation packages using --force-reinstall. Defaults FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed py_install, : method: Installation method ("auto", "virtualenv", "conda") envname: Python environment name (default: "r-land4health")

title: Install Python dependencies for land4health package — l4h_install
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effects.

title: Install Python dependencies for land4health package — l4h_install
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic installation l4h_install()  # Force reinstallation l4h_install(force = TRUE)  # Use a conda environment l4h_install(method = "conda") } # }

what: List malaria layers by species & metric from Malaria Atlas Project — l4h_layers_available_malaria
title: List malaria layers by species & metric from Malaria Atlas Project — l4h_layers_available_malaria
text: Provides tidy listing malaria data layers Malaria Atlas Project GeoServer, including separate columns species (Plasmodium falciparum vs. Plasmodium vivax), year, month, metric (e.g. incidence_rate, parasite_rate, mortality_count, etc.). layers cover modeled estimates malaria prevalence, incidence, mortality , global scale, broken species time.

title: List malaria layers by species & metric from Malaria Atlas Project — l4h_layers_available_malaria
code: l4h_layers_available_malaria(year = NULL, species = NULL, measure = NULL)

title: List malaria layers by species & metric from Malaria Atlas Project — l4h_layers_available_malaria
text: year Integer integer vector. Optional filter dataset year (e.g. 2024). species Character character vector. Optional filter species: "plasmodium falciparum" "plasmodium vivax" measure Character character vector. Optional filter metric type: e.g. "incidence_rate", "parasite_rate", "mortality_count", "reproductive_number".

title: List malaria layers by species & metric from Malaria Atlas Project — l4h_layers_available_malaria
text: tibble columns: workspace  — always "malaria" year       — dataset year month      — dataset month (NA annual) species    — full species name (lowercase) measure    — metric type (lowercase) dataset_id — original coverage ID subsequent WMS/WCS requests

title: List malaria layers by species & metric from Malaria Atlas Project — l4h_layers_available_malaria
text: Malaria Atlas Project https://malariaatlas.org/ provides globally modeled raster surfaces key malaria indicators. function retrieves available coverage IDs GeoServer, parses species, time, metric, returns user-friendly table easy filtering selection.

title: List malaria layers by species & metric from Malaria Atlas Project — l4h_layers_available_malaria
code: # \donttest{ # list all available malaria layers all_layers <- l4h_layers_available_malaria() head(all_layers) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   workspace  year month species               measure         dataset_id         #>   <chr>     <int> <int> <chr>                 <chr>           <chr>              #> 1 malaria    2022     6 plasmodium falciparum mortality_count Malaria__202206_G… #> 2 malaria    2024     6 plasmodium falciparum mortality_count Malaria__202406_G… #> 3 malaria    2022     6 plasmodium falciparum mortality_rate  Malaria__202206_G… #> 4 malaria    2024     6 plasmodium falciparum mortality_rate  Malaria__202406_G… #> 5 malaria    2022     6 plasmodium falciparum incidence_rate  Malaria__202206_G… #> 6 malaria    2024     6 plasmodium falciparum incidence_rate  Malaria__202406_G…  # filter for Plasmodium falciparum parasite rate in 2024 pf_pr_2024 <- l4h_layers_available_malaria(   year    = 2024,   species = "plasmodium falciparum",   measure = "parasite_rate" ) print(pf_pr_2024) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   workspace  year month species               measure       dataset_id           #>   <chr>     <int> <int> <chr>                 <chr>         <chr>                #> 1 malaria    2024     6 plasmodium falciparum parasite_rate Malaria__202406_Glo… # }

what: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
text: Returns tibble metadata every metric shipped land4health.  can optionally filter thematic category, metric short name, provider. open_in_browser = TRUE, matching URLs opened default browser; safety must supply least one filter, —five tabs open—asked confirm interactive sessions.

title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
code: l4h_list_metrics(   category = NULL,   metric = NULL,   provider = NULL,   open_in_browser = FALSE )

title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
text: category Optional single string. Filter thematic category. metric Optional single string. Filter metric short name. provider Optional single string. Filter dataset column. open_in_browser Logical; open matching URLs browser? Defaults FALSE.

title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
text: tibble (returned invisibly).  open_in_browser = FALSE compact preview (max 10 rows) printed tibble returned.

title: List available metrics in land4health — l4h_list_metrics
code: ## All examples keep `open_in_browser = FALSE` to avoid side-effects ## during automated checks.  ## 1  Show the full inventory (truncated to 10 rows). l4h_list_metrics() #> # A tibble: 10 × 11 #>    category           metric  pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>    <chr>              <chr>   <chr>                  <chr>        <int>    <int> #>  1 Human intervention Defore… 30                     Hansen…       2000     2023 #>  2 Human intervention Human … 300                    Global…       1990     2017 #>  3 Human intervention Popula… 100                    WorldP…       2000     2021 #>  4 Human intervention Urban … 500                    MODIS …       2001     2022 #>  5 Human intervention Night … 500                    VIIRS …       1992     2023 #>  6 Human intervention Human … 30                     Global…       1975     2030 #>  7 Enviroment         Water … 30                     MapBio…       1985     2022 #>  8 Enviroment         Urban … 1000                   Urban …       2003     2020 #>  9 Accesibility       Travel… 927.67                 Malari…       2019     2020 #> 10 Accesibility       Rural … 100                    Rural …       2024     2024 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr> #> ... (1 more)  ## 2  Filter by category (“Human intervention”). l4h_list_metrics(category = "Human intervention") #> # A tibble: 6 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Defores… 30                     Hansen…       2000     2023 #> 2 Human intervention Human M… 300                    Global…       1990     2017 #> 3 Human intervention Populat… 100                    WorldP…       2000     2021 #> 4 Human intervention Urban a… 500                    MODIS …       2001     2022 #> 5 Human intervention Night t… 500                    VIIRS …       1992     2023 #> 6 Human intervention Human S… 30                     Global…       1975     2030 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr>  ## 3  Filter by provider (“WorldPop”) and store the result. worldpop_tbl <- l4h_list_metrics(provider = "WorldPop") #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Populat… 100                    WorldP…       2000     2021 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr> head(worldpop_tbl) #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   category           metric   pixel_resolution_met…¹ dataset start_year end_year #>   <chr>              <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>        <int>    <int> #> 1 Human intervention Populat… 100                    WorldP…       2000     2021 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​pixel_resolution_meters #> # ℹ 5 more variables: resolution_temporal <chr>, layer_can_be_actived <lgl>, #> #   tags <chr>, lifecycle <chr>, url <chr>

what: Extracts global night‑time lights using harmonized DMSP‑OLS and VIIRS data — l4h_night_lights
title: Extracts global night‑time lights using harmonized DMSP‑OLS and VIIRS data — l4h_night_lights
text: Retrieves annual night‑time light radiance (average radiance, nanoWatt/sr/cm²) Harmonized Global Night Time Lights dataset user-defined region time range. dataset harmonizes DMSP-OLS (1992‑2013) VIIRS‑like data (2014‑2021), ensuring consistent long-term time series ~1km resolution.

title: Extracts global night‑time lights using harmonized DMSP‑OLS and VIIRS data — l4h_night_lights
code: l4h_night_lights(   from,   to,   region,   stat = "mean",   scale = 1000,   sf = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Extracts global night‑time lights using harmonized DMSP‑OLS and VIIRS data — l4h_night_lights
text: Character. Start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format (year used). Character. End date "YYYY-MM-DD" format (year used). region spatial object (sf, sfc, SpatVector) defining region interest. stat Character. Summary statistic apply per year per region (e.g. "mean", "sum"). scale Numeric. Nominal scale meters (default 1000). sf Logical. TRUE, return sf; FALSE, return tibble. Default TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress messages. Default FALSE. force Logical. TRUE, skip representativity check. Default FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed rgee::ee_extract().

title: Extracts global night‑time lights using harmonized DMSP‑OLS and VIIRS data — l4h_night_lights
text: sf tibble annual night‑time light statistics per region date.

title: Extracts global night‑time lights using harmonized DMSP‑OLS and VIIRS data — l4h_night_lights
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) library(sf) ee_Initialize()  # Define a bounding box region in Ucayali, Peru region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # Extract only DMSP-OLS data (1998–2010) ntl_dmsp <- l4h_night_lights(   from = "1998-01-01",   to = "2010-12-31",   region = region,   stat = "mean" ) head(ntl_dmsp)  # Extract only VIIRS data (2016–2021) ntl_viirs <- l4h_night_lights(   from = "2016-01-01",   to = "2021-12-31",   region = region,   stat = "mean" ) head(ntl_viirs)  # Extract both DMSP and VIIRS (2008–2020) ntl_mixed <- l4h_night_lights(   from = "2008-01-01",   to = "2020-12-31",   region = region,   stat = "mean" ) head(ntl_mixed) } # }

title: List all land4health packages — l4h_packages
text: List land4health packages

title: List all land4health packages — l4h_packages
code: l4h_packages(include_self = TRUE)

title: List all land4health packages — l4h_packages
text: include_self default TRUE. Includes "land4health" package name resultant character vector.

title: List all land4health packages — l4h_packages
text: character vector package names included "land4health" meta-package.

title: List all land4health packages — l4h_packages
code: l4h_packages() #> [1] "rgee"        "sf"          "land4health"

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: Calculates Rural Access Index (RAI) given region using datasets GEE Community Catalog. RAI represents proportion rural population living within 2 km -season road, aligning SDG indicator 9.1.1.

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
code: l4h_rural_access_index(   region,   weighted = FALSE,   fun = NULL,   sf = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: region spatial object defining region interest. Can sf, sfc object, SpatVector (terra package). weighted Logical. TRUE, computes population-weighted RAI (.e., rural population access divided total rural population). FALSE, computes area-based RAI (.e., total pixel area access divided total rural area). Default FALSE. fun Character. Summary function apply population raster weighted = TRUE. Common values include "mean", "sum", etc. Ignored weighted = FALSE. Default "mean". sf Logical. TRUE, returns result sf object. FALSE, returns Earth Engine object. Default FALSE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). force Logical. TRUE, skips representativity check forces extraction. Default FALSE. ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: spatial object containing computed RAI value region sf tibble object.

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: function uses following datasets GEE Community Catalog: projects/sat-io/open-datasets/RAI/ruralpopaccess/ – raster rural population access -season roads projects/sat-io/open-datasets/RAI/inaccessibilityindex/ – binary raster indicating access areas (1 = access, 0 = access) weighted = TRUE, RAI calculated sum (chosen summary via fun) accessible rural population divided total rural population within specified region. weighted = FALSE, RAI calculated ratio pixel areas: total area (km^2) access divided total rural area. fun parameter applies weighted = TRUE. ignored otherwise.

title: Compute Rural Access Index (RAI) — l4h_rural_access_index
text: GEE Community Catalog: https://gee-community-catalog.org/projects/rai/ Frontiers Remote Sensing (2024): doi:10.3389/frsen.2024.1375476

what: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
text: function accesses geeSEBAL-MODIS collection published ET-Brasil project, extracts etp band (daily evapotranspiration mm/day), allows temporal aggregation 8-day images monthly yearly composites period. Optionally, results can returned sf/tibble objects R.

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
code: l4h_sebal_modis(   from,   to,   by = "8 days",   region,   fun = "mean",   sf = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   ... )

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
text: Start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. End date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. Temporal aggregation frequency. Options: "8 days" (original 8-day composites), "month" (monthly average sum), "annual" (annual avergae sumperiod). region spatial object defining region interest. Accepts sf, SpatVector, ee$FeatureCollection objects. fun Aggregation function = "month" "total". Valid values "mean" "sum". sf Logical. Return result sf object? Default TRUE. force Logical. TRUE, forces download even local file already exists. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
text: sf tibble object etp values.

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
text: Comini,B., Ruhoff,., Laipelt,L., Fleischmann,., Huntington,J., Morton,C., Melton,F., Erickson,T., Roberti,D., Souza,V., Biudes,M., Machado,N., Santos,C. & Cosio,E. (2023). geeSEBAL‑MODIS: Continental‑scale evapotranspiration based surface energy balance South America. Preprint. DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.17579.11041 geeSEBAL‑MODIS v0‑02 dataset. Licensed Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC‑‑4.0) license.

title: Download and process evapotranspiration data — l4h_sebal_modis
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  library(land4health) ee_Initialize()  # Define a bounding box region in Ucayali, Peru region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # 1. Eight-day composites (8 days) # 2020-01-01 → 2020-12-31, reducer = "mean" sebal_8d <- l4h_sebal_modis(   from   = "2020-01-01",   to     = "2020-12-31",   region = region )  # 2. Monthly means # Same period, but aggregated to calendar months sebal_month <- l4h_sebal_modis(   from   = "2020-01-01",   to     = "2020-12-31",   by     = "month",   region = region )  # 3. Annual evapotranspiration # 2015 → 2023, one value per year sebal_annual <- l4h_sebal_modis(   from   = 2015,   to     = 2023,   by     = "annual",   fun    = "sum",   region = region,   sf     = FALSE )  } # }

what: Extracts Land Surface Temperature (LST) from MODIS MOD11A1 — l4h_surface_temp
title: Extracts Land Surface Temperature (LST) from MODIS MOD11A1 — l4h_surface_temp
text: Extracts daytime nighttime Land Surface Temperature (LST) user-defined region time range using MODIS MOD11A1.061 product. function supports summarizing temperature data date using selected statistic (e.g., mean median).

title: Extracts Land Surface Temperature (LST) from MODIS MOD11A1 — l4h_surface_temp
code: l4h_surface_temp(   from,   to,   region,   band = "day",   level = "strict",   scale = 1000,   stat = "mean",   sf = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = TRUE,   ... )

title: Extracts Land Surface Temperature (LST) from MODIS MOD11A1 — l4h_surface_temp
text: Character Date. Start date analysis (e.g., "2020-01-01"). Character Date. End date analysis (e.g., "2020-12-31"). region spatial object defining region interest. Accepts sf, sfc, SpatVector object. band Character. LST type extract: "day" (LST_Day_1km) "night" (LST_Night_1km). Default "day". level Character. Quality filter level apply MODIS LST pixels. Use "strict" retain high-quality observations (QA bits 0–1 equal 00), "moderate" allow high acceptable quality (QA bits 0–1 equal 00 01). Default "moderate". scale Numeric. Spatial resolution meters. Default 1000 (native resolution). stat Character. Summary statistic apply per image per region. One "mean", "median", "min", "max". Passed ee_extract(). sf Logical. TRUE, returns sf object; FALSE, returns tibble. Default TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses progress bars messages. Default FALSE. force Logical. TRUE, forces extraction even results cached. Default FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed rgee::ee_extract().

title: Extracts Land Surface Temperature (LST) from MODIS MOD11A1 — l4h_surface_temp
text: sf tibble object LST values (degrees Celsius) extracted MODIS MOD11A1.

title: Extracts Land Surface Temperature (LST) from MODIS MOD11A1 — l4h_surface_temp
text: MODIS MOD11A1.061 product provides daily Land Surface Temperature quality information. function filters low-quality cloud-contaminated pixels based QC_Day QC_Night band. pixels quality control bits 0–1 equal 00 (high quality) retained. LST values originally stored Kelvin multiplied 0.02. function automatically converts degrees Celsius using formula: LST = (value × 0.02) - 273.15.

title: Extracts Land Surface Temperature (LST) from MODIS MOD11A1 — l4h_surface_temp
text: Wan, Z., Hook, S., & Hulley, G. (2015). MOD11A1 MODIS/Terra Land Surface Temperature Emissivity Daily L3 Global 1km SIN Grid V006 (Version 6.1). NASA EOSDIS Land Processes DAAC. https://doi.org/10.5067/MODIS/MOD11A1.061 MODIS MOD11A1.061 - Google Earth Engine Dataset Catalog. https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/catalog/MODIS_061_MOD11A1

title: Extracts Land Surface Temperature (LST) from MODIS MOD11A1 — l4h_surface_temp
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) ee_Initialize()  # Define a bounding box region in Ucayali, Peru region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # Extract daytime LST for 2020 lst_day <- l4h_surface_temp(   from = "2020-01-01",   to = "2020-12-31",   region = region,   band = "day",   stat = "mean")  head(lst_day)  # Extract nighttime LST lst_night <- l4h_surface_temp(  from = "2020-01-01",  to = "2020-12-31",  region = region,  band = "night",  stat = "mean")  head(lst_night) } # }

what: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
text: Retrieves travel time raster (minutes) nearest healthcare facility populated city, based Oxford Global Map Accessibility datasets.

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
code: l4h_travel_time(   region,   destination = "cities",   transport_mode = "all",   fun = "mean",   sf = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
text: region spatial object defining region interest. Can sf, sfc object, SpatVector (terra package). destination Character. Target destination travel time. Use "healthcare" (default) travel time nearest healthcare facility, "cities" travel time nearest populated urban center. transport_mode Character. Mode transportation. Use "" (default) general travel time (mixed modes), "walking_only" walking-accessibility (valid destination = "healthcare"). fun Character. Summary function apply. Values include "mean", "sum","median" , etc. Default "mean". sf Logical. TRUE, returns result sf object. FALSE, returns Earth Engine object. Default FALSE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). force Logical. TRUE, skips internal representativity check input region. Defaults FALSE. ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
text: spatial object containing computed RAI value region sf tibble object.

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
text: Weiss, D.J. et al. (2018). global map travel time cities assess inequalities accessibility 2015. Nature, 553(7688), 333–336. DOI: 10.1038/nature25181 Weiss, D.J. et al. (2020). Global maps travel time healthcare facilities. Nature Medicine, 26, 1835–1838. DOI: 10.1038/s41591-020-1059-1

title: Travel Time to Healthcare or Cities (Oxford Dataset) — l4h_travel_time
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) library(sf) ee_Initialize()  # Define a bounding-box region in Ucayali, Peru region <- st_as_sf(   st_sfc(     st_polygon(list(matrix(       c(         -74.1, -4.4,         -74.1, -3.7,         -73.2, -3.7,         -73.2, -4.4,         -74.1, -4.4       ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE     )))   ),   crs = 4326 )  # Travel time to nearest healthcare facility (all modes) result_hosp_all <- l4h_travel_time(region = region) head(result_hosp_all)  # Travel time to nearest healthcare facility (walking only) result_hosp_walk <- l4h_travel_time(   region        = region,   destination   = "healthcare",   transport_mode = "walking_only")  head(result_hosp_walk)  # Mean travel time to nearest cities (mixed modes) result_city_mean <- l4h_travel_time(   region      = region,   destination = "cities",   fun         = "mean")  head(result_city_mean)  # Sum of travel time to nearest cities result_city_sum <- l4h_travel_time(   region      = region,   destination = "cities",   fun         = "sum")  head(result_city_sum) } # }

what: Calculates the Surface Urban Heat Island (SUHI) index using MODIS LST and GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_heat_index
title: Calculates the Surface Urban Heat Island (SUHI) index using MODIS LST and GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_heat_index
text: Computes SUHI (Surface Urban Heat Island) index difference mean land surface temperature (LST) urban rural areas date user-defined region time range.

title: Calculates the Surface Urban Heat Island (SUHI) index using MODIS LST and GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_heat_index
code: l4h_urban_heat_index(   from,   to,   region,   band = "day",   level = "strict",   stat = "max",   scale = 1000,   sf = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Calculates the Surface Urban Heat Island (SUHI) index using MODIS LST and GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_heat_index
text: Character Date. Start date (format: "YYYY-MM-DD"). Character Date. End date (format: "YYYY-MM-DD"). region Spatial object (sf, sfc, SpatVector) defining region. band Character. "day" "night" LST MODIS. Default "day". level Character. "strict" "moderate" quality filter MODIS. Default "strict". stat Character. Aggregation statistic, e.g. "mean" "median". Default "mean". scale Numeric. Resolution meters. Default 1000. sf Logical. TRUE, returns sf; FALSE, returns tibble. Default TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress messages. Default FALSE. force Logical. TRUE, skip representativity check. Default FALSE. ... Extra arguments passed ee_extract().

title: Calculates the Surface Urban Heat Island (SUHI) index using MODIS LST and GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_heat_index
text: tibble sf object columns: date, variable = "SUHI", value (°C).

title: Calculates the Surface Urban Heat Island (SUHI) index using MODIS LST and GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_heat_index
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) ee_Initialize()  # Define a bounding box region (Ucayali, Peru) region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # Calculate SUHI using daytime LST (mean temperature difference) suhi_day <- l4h_urban_heat_index(   from = "2020-01-01",   to = "2020-12-31",   region = region,   band = "day",   stat = "mean" ) head(suhi_day)  # Calculate SUHI using nighttime LST (max difference) suhi_night <- l4h_urban_heat_index(   from = "2020-01-01",   to = "2020-12-31",   region = region,   band = "night",   stat = "max" ) head(suhi_night) } # }

what: Extracts surface areas by urban and rural categories from GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_rural_area
title: Extracts surface areas by urban and rural categories from GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_rural_area
text: Calculates surface area (km2) urban, rural, settlement classes every 5 years 1985 2030 using GHS-SMOD R2023A dataset. product applies Degree Urbanization methodology (Stage ) GHS-POP R2023A GHS-BUILT-S R2023A layers. function summarizes areas category year specified region.

title: Extracts surface areas by urban and rural categories from GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_rural_area
code: l4h_urban_rural_area(   region,   category = "all",   scale = 1000,   sf = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Extracts surface areas by urban and rural categories from GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_rural_area
text: region sf object defining region interest. category Character. Settlement category extract: "urban", "rural", "". scale Numeric. Spatial resolution (meters) use area calculation (e.g., 30). sf Logical. TRUE, returns sf object. Default TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses progress messages. Default FALSE. force Logical. TRUE, forces extraction request even cached results exist. ... Additional arguments passed ee_extract() rgee package.

title: Extracts surface areas by urban and rural categories from GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_rural_area
text: tibble estimated settlement area (km2) year category.

title: Extracts surface areas by urban and rural categories from GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_rural_area
text: European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC). GHS Settlement Grid R2023A (1975–2030). Available : https://data.jrc.ec.europa.eu/dataset/a0df7a6f-49de-46ea-9bde-563437a6e2ba#dataaccess

title: Extracts surface areas by urban and rural categories from GHS-SMOD — l4h_urban_rural_area
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) ee_Initialize()  # Define region as a bounding box (Ucayali, Peru) region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # Extract surface area of urban category (in km2) urban_area <- l4h_urban_area(   category = "urban",   region = region)  head(urban_area)  # Extract surface area of rural category (in km2) rural_area <- l4h_urban_area(   category = "rural",   region = region)  head(rural_area)  # Extract total surface area (urban + rural) (in km2) all_area <- l4h_urban_area(   category = "all",   region = region)  head(all_area) } # }

text: function returns proportion region's area covered surface water year. values expressed decimal ratio 0 1 (e.g., 0.25 means 25\

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Peru — l4h_water_proportion
code: l4h_water_proportion(   from,   to,   region,   fun = "mean",   sf = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   ... )

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Peru — l4h_water_proportion
text: Integer. Start year (e.g., 1985). Integer. End year (e.g., 2022). Must equal greater . region spatial object defining region interest. Can sf, sfc object, SpatVector (terra package). fun Character. Summary function apply. Values include "mean", "sum","median" , etc. Default "mean". sf Logical. Return result sf object? Default TRUE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppress progress bar (default FALSE). FALSE, returns Earth Engine ImageCollection. force Logical. TRUE, skips internal representativity checks input geometry. Defaults FALSE. ... arguments ee_extract rgee packages.

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Peru — l4h_water_proportion
text: object containing annual water coverage. Depending sf, may sf object, list, Earth Engine ImageCollection yearly layers.

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Peru — l4h_water_proportion
text: MapBiomas Peru (2021). Collection 1 – Annual water coverage. Mapbiomas project, available : https://peru.mapbiomas.org/colecciones-de-mapbiomas-peru/

title: Annual Proportion of Water Coverage from MapBiomas Peru — l4h_water_proportion
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(land4health) ee_Initialize()  # Define region as a bounding box (Ucayali, Peru) region <- st_as_sf(st_sfc(   st_polygon(list(matrix(c(     -74.1, -4.4,     -74.1, -3.7,     -73.2, -3.7,     -73.2, -4.4,     -74.1, -4.4   ), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))),   crs = 4326 ))  # Extract water coverage between 2000 and 2020 l4h_water_proportion(   from = 2000,   to = 2020,   region = region) } # }
